text: Quintero brothers, photograph by Serafín Álvarez Quintero (March 26, 1871 – April 12, 1938) and Joaquín Álvarez Quintero (January 20, 1873 – June 14, 1944) were Spanish dramatists. ==Lives and career== Born in Utrera, Seville Province, they wrote almost 200 plays which won (Spanish language: Quintero brothers) fame as the Golden Boys of the Madrid theatre. Their first stage piece, , was written in 1889. Other works include (1898), and (1907), (1909), and (1915). They were also famous for having tried to transcribe Andalusian dialects to written form. ==External links== * * * * Category:1871 births Category:1938 deaths Category:1873 births Category:1944 deaths Category:People from Utrera Category:19th-century Spanish writers Category:19th-century male writers Category:20th-century Spanish writers Category:20th-century Spanish male writers Category:Members of the Royal Spanish Academy
title: Quintero brothers
